item.title: Multichannel Lockin v2.14.2.65
item.description:
Product: Multichannel Lockin v2.14.2.65
Company: LevyLab
Release Date: Fri, 27 Aug 2021 14:15:20 -0400
Packager: Patrick Irvin

Description: Multichannel Lockin for National Instruments' Dynamic Signal Acquisition hardware (4431, 4461, 4462). This version is configured to handle multiple cards (up to 16) for simultaneous, synchronized AI/AO. You can configure a number of analog outputs (up to 32) to output sine, square, sawtooth, or triangle functions with DC offsets. Each of the analog inputs (up to 32) can be demodulated at multiple frequencies.

Release Notes: [2.14.2]
- LV2019, Instrument Framework v1.19, SMO v1.4
- fix Issue #42: error 1077 at startup

[2.14.1]
- Fix issue with outputs not maintaining value at startup
- UI changes and improvements

[2.14.0]
- Updated AO Channels, AI Channels, Reference Channels datatypes: Array of Clusters instead of Cluster of Arrays
- Updated Lockin Results datatyp: Dictionary; APIs are provided for parsing the dicrtionary
- Each reference channel has independent control of time constant (Maximum of 4 reference channels)\
- Individual choice for demodulating each AI Channel (e.g., demodulate each AI with choice of Reference channel, no demodulation, or all demodulation channels)
- Reset phase option: align AO and Reference phase without resetting DAQ tasks
- UI improvements
item.dc:creator: LevyLab

item.title: PPMS Monitor and Control v1.8.0.46
item.description:
Product: PPMS Monitor and Control v1.8.0.46
Company: LevyLab
Release Date: Fri, 27 Aug 2021 14:15:17 -0400
Packager: Patrick Irvin

Description: Program for logging PPMS status to the PGSQL database. Provides a UI and API for controlling magnet field, temperature, and rotator angle (for PPM2)

Release Notes: [1.8.0]
- Update to LV 2019
- Update to Instrument Framework v1.9.0
- Change class structure
- Control chamber; Display and log chamber status
item.dc:creator: LevyLab

item.title: Instrument Framework v1.9.0.8
item.description:
Product: Instrument Framework v1.9.0.8
Company: LevyLab
Release Date: Fri, 27 Aug 2021 14:15:14 -0400
Packager: Patrick Irvin

Description: An object-oriented framework based on JKI SMOs, developed by the LevyLab at the University of Pittsburgh.

An Instrument developed using this framework will have the access to the following capabilities:

- Method for communicate with a piece of hardware (provides a hardware abstraction layer (HAL))
- Periodically polls the instrument for its settings and logs them to a PGSQL database
- Defines an API to allow external programs to control compiled instances of the application and remotely across a network (Either NI's Simple Messaging Library (STM) (deprecated in v1.9) or cross-platform protocol ZMQ (preferred beginning with v1.9))
- Provide a user interface (optional but probably desirable).
- Methods for reading and writing configuration from disk.

The LevyLab Instrument Framework makes extensive use of JKI State Machines and State Machine Objects.

Release Notes: [1.9.0]
!--> First version requiring LabVIEW 2019 <--!

RemoteControl.lvclass (and childen)
- Message IDs are now stored as strings rather than integers
- Unused methods have been removed and remaining methods are reorganized on disk

RemoteControl.ZMQ.lvclass
- ZMQ protocal has better supported in this release.
- JSON-RPC 2.0 is used to encode message data.

JSON-RPC 2.0
- Uses JSONtext package and malleable VIs
- Batch messages are supported but not fully tested. (You are on your own to decode the batch requests.)

New/Changed APIs:
- Remote Client.vim
- GET ALL.vim
- Enum to String.vim
- Variant to LV Data.vim
- State History.vi

Bug Fixes:
[1]: Improved handling of bad instrument (hw) connection
[6]: Reliable ZMQ messaging
[16]: Restart RC Server on error
[34]: Issue with reading config file in a non-existent folder (Framework will now generate the folder hierarchy and missig file)
[36]: Get All is malleable method
[38][39][40][41][42]: dealing with malleable VIs and data conversion
item.dc:creator: LevyLab

item.dc:creator: Levylab

item.title: Transport v1.4.5.22
item.description:
Product: Transport v1.4.5.22
Company: Levylab
Release Date: Thu, 03 Jun 2021 21:26:55 -0400
Packager: Patrick Irvin

Description: VIs for scripting and performing transport measurments.

[Control Experiment.lvclass]
Control Experiment.vi provides a uniform way to record information about your sample & device, how the lockin is connected to the device, configures the Krohn Hite amplifier (and Pickering switch if you have one), and sets the base path for saving data.

[SweepControl.lvclass]
Sweep Control.vi: Sequencer for stepping multiple parameters. Calls VIs in Transport.lvclass
Continuous B sweep.vi: For sweeping B continuously while asynchronously calling VIs in Transport.lvclass

[Transport.lvclass]
Basic transport measurments.
- Lockin vs Vsg (or Vbg) (Lockin_Vsg.vi)
- Lockin vs Time (Lockin_time.vi)
- Lockin Sweep Mode (Lockin_sweep.vi (under development)
- IV curves (IV.vi)

Release Notes: [1.4.5]
- Hotfix for latest lockin version
- updated dependencies
- includes some changes from MNK
item.dc:creator: Levylab

item.title: Razorbill RP100 v21.0.0.2
item.description:
Product: Razorbill RP100 v21.0.0.2
Company: Levylab
Release Date: Fri, 21 May 2021 10:49:40 -0400
Packager: Patrick Irvin

Description: Divers for Razorbill RP100 HV amplifier

Release Notes: [21.0.0.1]
- adds SMO-based monitor and control process
- logs each channel's output state, level, slew, voltage, and current to the PGSQL database
APIs:
- Set Strain automatically sets V1 = -V2
- Set Level sets the level of a single, selectable output channel
- Get Strain returns the level for channel 1
- Get Level returns the level from the selected single channel
